page.title: 01East of Harwood Dale
page.content: Moors and forest, east of Harwood Dale The block is gently undulating moorland with no dominant features. The heather moorland in the north and west is accessible by footpath and as well as walkers, it may be used by grouse shooting and perhaps for bee keeping. Most of the block however is covered in commercial forestry conifer plantations. This is a network of forestry tracks for working access but no public roads enter the block so its potential for tourism is limited to those who are prepared to walk. The block borders on the Fylingdales early warning station land so access if further restricted in the north west. There is some rough sheep and cattle grazing along the valley of the Derwent which originates in this block.
